documentation.intro: This application helps you organize your photos of items for sale and create complete product sheets. This guide will explain step by step how to use each function.
documentation.introText: This application helps you organize your photos of items for sale and create complete product sheets. Imagine you sell items on eBay, Craigslist or other platforms: this application will allow you to centralize everything in one place and save precious time!
documentation.categoryExplanation: A category is like a big box in which you will organize your items by theme. For example: a 'Ceramics' box for all your plates, vases, etc. A 'Jewelry' box for your necklaces, rings, etc.
documentation.categoryBenefit1: You find your items more easily
documentation.categoryBenefit2: Your photos are automatically organized into folders
documentation.categoryBenefit3: You can filter your items by category later
documentation.howToCreateCategory: âœ¨ How to create your first category?
documentation.categoryStep1: Step 1: Look at the left of your screen, see the black menu? Click on 'Objects' (the icon looks like a 3D cube)
documentation.categoryStep2: Step 2: Click on 'Categories' - A new page opens with your list of categories
documentation.categoryStep3: Step 3: Click on the blue button 'New Category' (top right)
documentation.categoryStep4: Step 4: In the 'Name' field, type the name of your category (example: 'Ceramics' or 'Jewelry')
documentation.categoryStep5: Step 5: Click on 'Create' - And there you go! Your first category is created ðŸŽ‰
documentation.categoryDeleteWarning: If you delete a category, ALL photos in its folder will be permanently deleted from your computer. This is irreversible!
documentation.categoryAdvice: Tip: Create all your categories first before you start importing photos.
documentation.twoWaysToImport: ðŸ¤” Two ways to import photos
documentation.importExternal: External import: from USB drive, SD card, camera
documentation.importLocal: Local import: from a folder already on your computer
documentation.method1Title: ðŸ“¸ Method 1: Import from USB Drive or SD Card
documentation.method1Situation: Situation: You just took photos of your items with your camera or smartphone, and these photos are on an SD card or USB drive.
documentation.importStep1Title: Step 1: Plug in your USB drive or SD card
documentation.importStep1Detail: Plug your USB drive or SD card into your computer. Wait a few seconds for your computer to recognize it.
documentation.importStep2Title: Step 2: In the menu, click 'Photos' then 'Import'
documentation.importStep2Detail: A new page opens with several tabs at the top.
documentation.importStep3Title: Step 3: Click on the 'External Import' tab
documentation.importStep3Detail: The application will automatically search for connected devices. After a few seconds, you'll see your USB drive or SD card appear in the list.
documentation.importStep4Detail: The application scans all photos present. A number appears: '15 photos detected' for example.
documentation.importStep5Title: Step 5: Choose which photos to import
documentation.importOptionADetail: Leave the option 'Import all (default choice)' checked. This is the easiest way to start.
documentation.importStep6Title: Step 6: Choose where to store your photos (IMPORTANT!)
documentation.importDestinationOptionADetail: Your photos will go into a generic folder. It's simple and effective for beginners.
documentation.importStep7Title: Step 7: Give the folder a name
documentation.importFormatOptionADetail: The application automatically creates a folder with today's date (example: '2025-01-15_14h30').
documentation.importStep8Detail: You see a large 'Description' box: you can type notes. This description will be saved in a text file description.txt.
documentation.importStep9Title: Step 9: (Optional) Empty your USB drive after import
documentation.importStep9Detail: If you check 'Empty device after import', your photos will be deleted from the USB drive after import. Warning! Only check if you're sure. If you're a beginner: leave unchecked.
documentation.importStep10Detail: Click the big blue button 'Import X photo(s)'. A progress bar appears. Wait for it to finish. A success message appears.
documentation.congratulations: Congratulations! Your photos are now in the application!
documentation.method2Title: ðŸ’» Method 2: Import from a folder on your computer
documentation.method2Situation: Situation: Your photos are already somewhere on your computer (in 'My Documents', 'Desktop', etc.)
documentation.localImportStep3: Click 'Browse...' - A window from your computer opens
documentation.localImportStep4: Navigate to the folder containing your photos
documentation.localImportStep5: The application scans the folder and finds all photos
documentation.localImportStep6: Click 'Scan' - Photos are added to your collection
documentation.collectionTitle: STEP 3: Exploring and Organizing Your Photo Collection
documentation.seeAllPhotosDetail: In the left menu, click 'Photos' then 'Collection'. You now see your photo gallery! It looks like a file explorer.
documentation.interfaceIntro: Your screen is divided into several parts:
documentation.interfaceNavBar: Navigation bar (breadcrumb): shows where you are in your folders
documentation.interfaceSearch: Search bar: type a word to find a photo quickly
documentation.interfaceDisplay: Display area: you see your folders ðŸ“, photos ðŸ–¼ï¸ and text files ðŸ“„
documentation.interfaceToolbar: Toolbar: displays total, 'Create description file' button, 'Select all' button
documentation.basicActions: ðŸ“Œ Basic actions on your photos
documentation.viewPhotoDetail: Click once on a photo. It opens large in a window. To close: click the âœ• cross at the top right.
documentation.editPhotoDetail: Right click on the photo > 'Edit'. You can rotate, crop, adjust brightness and contrast. Choose 'Create a copy' to keep the original intact.
documentation.selectMultipleDetail: Click on the small box at the top left of each photo. A blue checkmark âœ“ appears. Buttons appear: Copy (green), Move (blue), Delete (red).
documentation.movePhotos: âž¤ Move photos to another folder
documentation.movePhotosDetail: Select photos, click 'Move' (blue), navigate in your folders, then click 'Move here'.
documentation.deletePhotosDetail: Select photos, click 'Delete' (red). An important option appears: 'Delete files from system'. If ENABLED (red): photos are physically deleted from your computer (irreversible). If DISABLED (gray): photos are just removed from the application but remain on your disk.
documentation.createDescriptionDetail: Make sure you're in the right folder. Click the blue button 'Create description file'. A description.txt file appears. Click on it to open and type your notes.
documentation.syncDatabaseDetail: Sometimes, you add or delete photos directly from your computer's file explorer. Click 'Synchronize' so the application detects all changes.
documentation.objectExplanation: An object is a complete product card for an item you want to sell. It contains: a name, a description, a category, photos, and additional information (year, weight, etc.).
documentation.method1ObjectTitle: âœ¨ Method 1: Create an object from the gallery (RECOMMENDED)
documentation.fastestMethod: This is the most convenient and fastest method!
documentation.method1ObjectDetail: Navigate in your gallery to a category subfolder. Select your object's photos. An orange 'Create object' button appears. Click on it, fill in the form (name, description, category), then click 'Create'. Your object is created with all associated photos!
documentation.method2ObjectTitle: âœ¨ Method 2: Create an object manually
documentation.method2ObjectDetail: In the menu, click 'Objects' > 'My Objects'. Click 'New Object'. Fill in the form. To add photos: hover over your object > click 'Manage photos' > select your photos.
documentation.editObjectDetail: Go to 'Objects' > 'My Objects'. Click on the object to see its card. Click 'Edit' (pencil icon). Modify what you want. Click 'Save'.
documentation.searchObjects: ðŸ” Search and filter your objects
documentation.searchObjectsDetail: Use the search bar at the top to find an object by name. Use the category filter to display only objects from a specific category.
documentation.advancedFeature: âš ï¸ Note: This part is more technical and not mandatory for beginners.
documentation.platformsExplanation: A platform is an online sales site like eBay, Craigslist, Etsy, etc. The application allows you to connect these platforms to centralize your accounts. This feature is intended for advanced users.
documentation.workflow2: Import your photos directly into the right folders
documentation.workflow3: Add description files in each folder
documentation.workflow4: Create your object cards by selecting photos from the gallery
documentation.workflow5: Check and adjust your object cards if needed
documentation.tip1: Name your folders well when importing
documentation.tip2: Use the object creation shortcut from the gallery (3x faster!)
documentation.tip3: Mark a photo as 'main' in categories
documentation.mistake1: Delete a category when it contains photos
documentation.mistake2: Edit the original photo without making a copy first
documentation.mistake3: Forget to select the right category when importing
documentation.goodPractice1: Always check where you are (look at the breadcrumb at the top)
documentation.goodPractice2: Make backup copies of your important photo folders
documentation.goodPractice3: Test first with a few photos before importing your entire collection
documentation.faq1Question: Q: Where are my photos physically stored?
documentation.faq1Answer: A: In the main folder you chose when first launching the application. You can find it in 'User Settings > Main Folder'.
documentation.faq2Question: Q: Can I use the application without Internet connection?
documentation.faq2Answer: A: Yes! The application works completely offline. Your photos and data are on your computer.
documentation.faq3Question: Q: If I delete an object, are my photos deleted?
documentation.faq3Answer: A: No! Only the object card is deleted. Your photos remain in your gallery.
documentation.faq4Question: Q: How do I back up everything?
documentation.faq4Answer: A: Simply copy the main folder (the one containing all your photos) to an external hard drive or to the cloud.
documentation.faq5Question: Q: The application slows down with many photos
documentation.faq5Answer: A: Click 'Synchronize' regularly and close/restart the application from time to time.
documentation.readyToUse: You're now ready to use Seller Library like a pro!
